latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

title: A bill to prohibit conflicts of interest among consulting firms that simultaneously contract with China or other covered foreign entities and the United States Government, and for other purposes.
ai_summary: A bill to prohibit conflicts of interest among consulting firms that simultaneously contract with China or other covered foreign entities and the U.S. Government. The bill would also apply to other purposes, such as for other purposes. It was introduced by Sen. Marco Rubio, R-Florida, on Wednesday. It is expected to be voted on by the Senate on Thursday. It would be the first of its kind in the Senate, which has a history of passing legislation on a bipartisan basis. It's expected to pass with a vote of more than 80 percent.
